Class: ProxyConnection

(abstract, protected) ProxyConnection(connectionManager, connectionProfile, businessNetworkIdentifier, socket, connectionID)

Base class representing a connection to a business network.

Constructor

(abstract, protected) new ProxyConnection(connectionManager, connectionProfile, businessNetworkIdentifier, socket, connectionID)

Constructor.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
connectionManager ConnectionManager

The owning connection manager.
connectionProfile string

The name of the connection profile associated with this connection
businessNetworkIdentifier string

The identifier of the business network for this connection
socket object

The connected socket.io client to use.
connectionID string

The connection ID.
Source:
  • proxyconnection.js, line 28

Methods

createIdentity(securityContext, userID, optionsopt) → {Promise}

Create a new identity for the specified user ID.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
securityContext SecurityContext

The participant's security context.
userID string

The user ID.
options object <optional>

Options for the new identity.

Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
issuer boolean <optional>

Whether or not the new identity should have
permissions to create additional new identities. False by default.
affiliation string <optional>

Specify the affiliation for the new
identity. Defaults to 'institution_a'.
Source:
  • proxyconnection.js, line 217
Returns:

A promise that is resolved with a generated user
secret once the new identity has been created, or rejected with an error.

Type
Promise

disconnect() → {Promise}

Terminate the connection to the business network.

Source:
  • proxyconnection.js, line 49
Returns:

A promise that is resolved once the connection has been
terminated, or rejected with an error.

Type
Promise

getNativeAPI()

Get the native API for this connection. The native API returned is specific
to the underlying blockchain platform, and may throw an error if there is no
native API available.

Source:
  • proxyconnection.js, line 268

Name Type Description

invokeChainCode(securityContext, functionName, args, options) → {Promise}

Invoke a "invoke" chaincode function with the specified name and arguments.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
securityContext SecurityContext

The participant's security context.
functionName string

The name of the chaincode function to invoke.
args Array.<string>

The arguments to pass to the chaincode function.
options Object

options to pass to invoking chaincode

Properties
Name Type Description
transactionId Object

Transaction Id to use.
Source:
  • proxyconnection.js, line 191
Returns:

A promise that is resolved with the data returned by the
chaincode function once it has been invoked, or rejected with an error.

Type
Promise

list(securityContext) → {Promise}

List all of the deployed business networks. The connection must
be connected for this method to succeed.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
securityContext SecurityContext

The participant's security context.
Source:
  • proxyconnection.js, line 235
Returns:

A promise that will be resolved with an array of
business network identifiers, or rejected with an error.

Promise

login(enrollmentID, enrollmentSecret) → {Promise}

Login as a participant on the business network.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
enrollmentID string

The enrollment ID of the participant.
enrollmentSecret string

The enrollment secret of the participant.
Source:
  • proxyconnection.js, line 74
Returns:

A promise that is resolved with a SecurityContext
object representing the logged in participant, or rejected with a login error.
